description: A traditional, ankle-length Buddhist skirt.  The bottom protrudes, and appears in the rough shape of a triangle.
A pair of basketball shorts.  Comfortable and light.
A well-made pair of old-fashioned pants, made of stiff yet baggy material.  Comfortable, but lacks pockets.
A breezy red cheerleader skirt.  Easy to move in, and of an acceptable length for most real cheerleading.
A very short and breezy red cheerleader skirt.  Easy to move in, but you will probably need shorts underneath to safely practice cheerleading in this.
Waterproof plastic fishing waders with a single large front pocket.
A simple pair of short shorts.
A simple pair of fur short shorts.
A simple pair of leather short shorts.
A pair of jeans with two deep pockets.

snippet_category.text: A pair of blue jeans with two deep pockets.
A pair of black jeans with two deep pockets.
A stylish pair of bleached denim jeans.
A pair of old baggy jeans.  The heels are all ripped up.

description: A pair of jeans that has been ripped over the knees.  It may have been fashionable before Cataclysm, but it's just a pair of sub-par jeans now.
A pair of vintage jeans that has started to lose its color.  It appears to be slightly heavier and thicker; but hey, don't let that stop you from wearing the fashion of the olden days!

snippet_category.text: A pair of vintage jeans that has been around for so long that very little remains of its once vibrant blue color.  Otherwise it's surprisingly well preserved though.
A very old pair of black vintage jeans.  From paint marks here and there you assume this belonged to a painter.
A groovy pair of stone washed denim jeans from the 80s.  It gets baggy around the ankles.  Perfect for pretending as if Cataclysm never happened and you are on your way to dance floor.

A pair of vintage blue jeans that has been preserved perfectly.  You can see the leather brand on its behind of company that hasn't been around for a long while, even before the Cataclysm.  This would have made a fortune if; well, you know, it wasn't apocalypse.

description: A pair of skinny jeans with two pockets.

snippet_category.text: A pair of blue skinny jeans with two pockets.
A pair of black skinny jeans with two pockets.
A pair of red skinny jeans with two pockets.

description: A pair of tight-fitting candy-apple-red jeans with two deep pockets.
No true Scotsman would leave home without his kilt.
No true Scotsman would leave home without his kilt.
Skin-tight nylon leggings, sometimes used when exercising, that keep your legs nice and warm.

variants.description: This pair is red.
This pair is blue.
This pair is a vibrant purple.
This pair is a muted olive green.
This pair is brown.
This pair is black.
This pair has a printed flame pattern.
This pair has a zebra stripe pattern.
This pair has a leopard print pattern.
This pair has a tiger stripe pattern.
This pair has a simple geometric pattern.

description: Rags stitched together and tied into a makeshift loincloth.  Covers your modesty, but not much else.
A fur pelt tied into a loincloth.  Covers your modesty, but not much else.  Now you are a true barbarian warrior.
Leather patches stitched together and tied into a makeshift loincloth.  Covers your modesty, but not much else.
Bits of wool stitched together and tied into a makeshift loincloth.  Covers your modesty, but not much else.
Apparently the microskirt wasn't short enough.
A pair of khaki pants.  Slightly warmer than jeans.

variants.description: A pair of khaki pants.  Slightly warmer than jeans.
A comfortable set of navy blue pants with large pockets, slightly thicker and warmer than regular jeans.
A snappy set of black, neatly pressed trousers, perfect for formal events or looking professional.

A set of storm gray pants speckled with dark stains so deeply assimilated into the fabric that they're nigh-irremovable.  You vehemently hope that they're just the mortal remains of some spilled beverage.
A pair of soft, comfortable burgundy trousers with a button-up fly and spacious pockets.
A set of rugged and comfortable trousers dyed a soft shade of violet, these pants come equipped with an adjustable waistband.
Boredom personified, this pair of corduroy pants is a dull hue of brown.
A pair of milky, off-white pants dyed a shade of soft cream.  They're slightly warmer than jeans.
A business-like set of stone-gray trousers for business-like people, these pants are the same hue as concrete and are relatively warm.
A pair of modest, beige-colored pants with a dirty white undertone.  These trousers are somewhat warmer than jeans.

While these pants might not be English, their color certainly is.  More specifically, these comfortable trousers are a shade of British-khaki, a type of brownish-yellow hue developed by the empire's military for use in service uniforms.
A pair of casual, tan-hued pants with a slight yellowish overtone, intended to contrast with one's skin color.

Flaunting an almost aggressively vibrant shade of bright pink, this pair of soft, plush pants is slightly warmer than far duller jeans and makes a bold statement to any onlookers: human, zombie, or otherwise.  Though, perhaps dressing up like an anthropomorphic Easter egg isn't, in retrospect, the wisest way to prolong your time on this earth.
A pair of comfortable pants dyed pebble-khaki, a type of hue consisting of muted greys and browns.

A pair of clear, creamy-hued ivory-colored pants, from which the inevitable splashes of zombie gore will be nigh-impossible to wash off.  The trousers are slightly warmer than jeans and provide a fashionable touch to your ventures in the ruins of New England.

A visually appealing and subtle blend of browns and deep reds characterizes this pair of pants, which come equipped with a drawstring at the waist, elastic cuffs, and zip-up pockets.  An energetic and sporting set of pants for high-energy situations.
A rustic blend of greenish browns characterizes this set of casual pants, along with a pair of deep pockets and a padded construction that makes them warmer than regular jeans.

While these aren't US-issued military trousers or even civilian tactical pants, this article of clothing possesses a blend of dark greens, browns, and blacks identical to the camouflage pattern of Vietnam-era army uniforms.  Slightly warmer than regular jeans, it's a decent piece of faux-military kit for those unwilling to shill out on a pair of actual BDU pants.

A pair of casual, greenish-blue trousers with deep pockets.  With the potential to be commendably fashionable and elegant given the right accompanying accents, the pants are a shade warmer than regular jeans.
A pair of moderately warm and comfortable ecru pants dyed a pale, greyish yellow color.
A pair of comfortable, light, delicate brown trousers dyed the same warm hue as young deer fawns.
Classy and stylish, this pair of warm, business-like trousers is dyed a neutral shade of camel.  A sophisticated pair of pants for only the most sophisticated of folks.

Dyed a rich shade of deep brown reminiscent of a piping-hot coffee, this pair of comfortable pants is excellent at concealing stains, whether from dropped food, spilled beverages, or, nowadays, dried blood.
A comfortable, earthy pair of soft green pants with a muted hue, they're slightly warmer than regular jeans and would blend in well against a backdrop of woodland moss.

Vibrant and bold, this pair of comfortable and statement-making trousers is dyed an energetic, spicy red color.  Somewhat warmer than regular jeans, you hope that wearing them won't increase your visual resemblance to a stuffed chili pepper.
Not too dissimilar from the pattern adopted by older US Marine uniforms, this pair of otherwise conventional civilian pants is printed with a green, brown, and black woodland camouflage pattern.

Similar in color to the old frog skin uniforms issued to Marine Raiders during the Second World War, this pair of warm, comfortable trousers is dyed a greenish gray hue.  Completely conventional in every other respect, the patterning would be incredibly helpful if you were planning to take a trip down to the Amazon any time soon.

Possessing reinforced knees and a hardy construction, this set of trousers is resplendent in a camouflage pattern of mixed light greens, browns, and beige tones.  With a set of deep pockets and an insulated design, it's an ideal piece of legwear for outdoor ventures.

The faithful friend of waterfowl hunters, this pair of pants is printed with a brown, gray, tan, and green camouflage pattern designed to blend in with the vegetation and reeds present in swamps and marshlands.

Dyed a mix of brown, tan, and yellowish beige hues, this pair of hardy trousers is designed to seamlessly blend into arid environments.  That being said, the fact that New England is famously devoid of deserts means that the pattern's only utility is in looking cool.

The companion of aspiring mountaineers and alpine hunters, these brown, gray, and white dyed pants possess a network of jagged shapes and mottled lines, designed to break up the wearer's profile and better conceal them against the background landscape of mountains.

A set of rugged yet comfortable pants dyed in various scales of gray, black, and dirty white, possessing a set of sizable pockets, and printed with squares and irregular polygons to disrupt a wearer's silhouette within man-made environments.  You would honestly not be surprised if you learned that this singular pair of trousers contains 50 shades of gray.

Printed with a camouflage pattern most commonly associated with naval vessels or aircraft, this pair of pants is festooned with a wide array of blue hues and disruptive lines, with a touch of light gray also making its presence known.  Warmer than jeans and possessing a number of deep pockets, this comfortable pair of trousers would do an admirable job of concealing you in maritime environments.  You have yet to come up with a reason why you'd ever be in a maritime environment.

Employed by anglers and river-side hunters for camouflage in freshwater habitats, this pair of bootcut trousers incorporates shades of green, brown, blue, and gray, along with sizable pockets and a construction favoring heat retention.

Featuring a camouflage pattern consisting of white, shades of gray, and a slight tinge of brown, this pair of rugged pants is fit for snowy tundra and polar regions—or it would be, had the garment not been only moderately warmer than jeans.  You have yet to grasp their point for existing.

Dyed a deep hue of urban black, this pair of hardwearing pants is designed to assist a wearer in concealing themselves within nighttime environments and low-light conditions.  While they're simple civilian trousers given a stealth-black paint job and don't hold a candle to their more marshal brothers, they still look cool and are great at making you feel like you're Spetsnaz.

Notorious for either looking fabulous or disastrous with little in between, this stylish pair of boot-cut white trousers will almost certainly gain a plethora of irremovable stains as soon as you set foot beyond the threshold of your abode.

With its fabric dyed a relatively pretty shade of deep reddish purple, this pair of pants not only looks good but also provides a level of practicality only befitting its role as sports wear, coming equipped with an elastic waistband and zip-up pockets.

While this plush pair of pink, flesh-colored trousers doesn't, thankfully, possess any unmentionables in and of itself, it will almost certainly make you look like you're striding about with your legs, caboose, and immodesty on display if it's too tight.  Who knows, perhaps it would be enough to blind some poor, unfortunate zombies.
A pair of delicately colored and fashionable pants dyed a pale, soft pink hue, much like cherry blossoms.
Dyed a light shade of almost sky-blue, this soft pair of trousers is both comfortable and warmer than regular jeans.
Stylish and refined-looking, this pair of elegant trousers is dyed a rich purple hue, like fresh, glistening grapes.  You wonder if that makes you look more or less appetizing to the zombies.
Soft, cool, and subtle, this pair of comfortable trousers sports a serene blue hue—a shade of azure as cold as the flesh of mankind's corpses.

Dyed the characteristic color of youth and whimsy, the gentle hue of this set of ethereal-blue pants offers recollections of dreamy, playful youth—a dream that no one upon this forsaken earth will ever know again.

There isn't such a thing as too shiny, or at least there wasn't for the maker of this particular pair of vibrant green pants.  Composed from glossy cotton dyed with a subtle blue cast and equipped with a pair of sizable pockets, it would be fashionable were it not for the fact that dawning them makes the wearer look like a post-apocalyptic leprechaun.
A centuries-old gift from the United Kingdom, this pair of comfortable trousers is dyed a classic shade of deep, vivid blue.
Dyed a predominantly greenish hue of deep cyan, this pair of pants is both comfortable and warmer than regular jeans.
A set of comfortable and smart-looking pants dyed a similar shade to volcanic ash: a pale, low-saturation grayish green color.
A bright, fashionable, and charming-looking pair of reddish purple trousers, with two deep pockets and a construction that favors heat retention more than regular jeans.
Dyed a soft shade of pink strongly verging upon an orange hue, this pair of trousers would look right at home against a backdrop of vibrant sea coral.

An almost fluorescent set of yellowish-green pants with two deep pockets.  Considering that chartreuse has better night-visibility than most other colors, these pants, apart from being a nightmare to match with other hues, would probably be an ill-advised choice to don if you wish to keep your legs attached to your body.
Reminiscent of the color of flames, this pair of cotton trackpants is, perhaps optimistically, dyed a muted shade of burned orange.
A pair of spiffy, bluish-purple trousers with deep pockets.  You feel smart and well-put-together just looking at it.

The classic color of vintage Corvette muscle cars, this pair of vibrant trousers is dyed an eye-bleedingly bright shade of crimson, a color in which they will shortly be bathed should any resident of the Cataclysm mangle you after spotting you by virtue of the cartoonishly energetic shade that these pants flaunt.

A fine choice to have donned during Veterans Day, this pair of warm, insulated trousers are dyed a pinkish red hue.  Perhaps it would be fitting to wear them again, for while in this war there aren't any poppies blowing between crosses, the heaps of dead are certainly high.

A pale mix of purple and pink, this pair of cotton sweatpants is not only comfortable and practical, with a set of spacious pockets, a drawstring waistband, and elastic cuffs, but also a smidge warmer than jeans.

A set of bewilderingly bright pants dyed a cheery shade of creamy yellow and sown with a set of deep pockets.  You are confused both as to which pre-Cataclysm fashion trend spawned this abomination and why its hue doesn't look like the actual fruit.

The world's a butchered hamburger of dead flesh, and you're the condiment.  At least, that's what you'll look like if you choose to stride about in this set of comfortable, insulated trousers, their fabric dyed a deep yellow and touched up by rich brown undertones.

Much like the bird from which the hue of this pair of pants derives its name, this set of trousers is dyed a warm and extremely vibrant hue of yellow.  Equipped with deep pockets and warmer than regular jeans, you feel relatively sure that wearing this would let you be seen by any survivors, zombies, or even the ISS, if it's still in orbit.

These pair of sky blue pants are resplendent with a pair of stitched American flags, their flag poles running down each leg, and a standard flanking the trousers' front and rear.  "Freedom" is boldly stitched across the fly and enclosed by a ring of golden stars, while the back bears the legend, "Liberbooty!"

description: A tough pair of pants lined with pockets.  Favored by the military.

snippet_category.text: A tough pair of pants.  Favored by the military.  This pair sports the US Army's gray, green and tan Universal Camouflage Pattern.  The pattern is notable for its lack of black.
A tough pair of military pants patterned in desert camouflage.  They are lined with deep pockets.
A tough pair of military pants with a black, green and tan pixel camouflage pattern.  Commonly seen worn by US Marines.
A tough pair of military pants with the black, brown, green and tan Battle Dress camouflage pattern.  They look old.
A tough pair of military pants with a predominantly dark blue camouflage.  Favored by the US Navy.

description: A pair of pants lined with pockets, offering lots of storage.
In a pinch, these pants can be used for an impromptu game of checkers.
A hefty pair of fur-lined pants.
A pair of long cotton pants lined with warm imitation fur.
A pair of black trousers with calf and waistband ties.  Comfortable to use but lacks pockets.
A pair of black leather pants.  Very tough, but cumbersome and without much storage.
A pair of pants meant for alpine skiing.
A pair of tight-fitting police breeches.  Offers lots of mobility for motorized officers.
A pair of dark blue shorts, the kind used by postal service workers.
A pair of red shorts with white trim.  For when Santa is on summer vacation.
A pair of red pants with white faux fur trim, commonly used by bearded men on Christmas.  Somewhat warm and has two deep pockets.
A pair of khaki shorts.
A pair of shorts lined with pockets, offering decent storage.
A pair of denim shorts.

snippet_category.text: A pair of stone wash denim shorts.
An old pair of denim jeans that have been cut down into shorts.
A pair of brand-name black denim shorts.

description: A blue skirt made from denim.
//: supossed to be a 10 oz denim skirt

description: A short, breezy cotton skirt.  Easy to move in, but only has a single small pocket.

This one is colored blue.
This one is colored yellow.
This one is colored green.
This one is colored purple.
This one is colored pink.
This one is colored cyan.
This one is colored black.
This one is colored white.
This one is colored brown.

description: A long skirt with no pockets.  Slightly more cumbersome but warmer than a normal skirt.
A primitive skirt made from grass.  Not actually useful for much other than looking like a tribal person.
A very short leather skirt, clearly designed to look good, not be practical.
A pair of pants with horizontal black and white stripes.
A pair of gray canvas work pants.

snippet_category.text: A pair of blue canvas work pants.
A pair of gray canvas work pants.
A pair of light-blue canvas work pants.

description: A tough pair of pants lined with pockets, thickly padded for warmth.  Favored by the military.
Plain white zubon for use in martial arts.
A water-resistant pair of lightweight, flexible hiking pants with a good number of pockets.

//: Based on Vertx Cutback Technical Pants, https://vertx.com/cutback-pants
description: Coated in more pockets than is probably either necessary or healthy and looking like they belong within a SWAT locker, these rugged combat pants possess a water-repellent coating, tough double-stitched seams, reinforced belt loops, and articulated knees.

variants.description: This particular pair is dyed a muted, beige-like shade of wolf gray.
This pair is predominantly an earthy shade of coyote brown.
This pair sports a warm, yellowish beige desert tan hue—a bold choice, considering New England's notable lack of deserts.
This worn and smoke-hued pair is completely dyed black.
This remarkably drab, traditional camouflage pair is dyed a muted shade of OD green, much like old US Army battle dress.

description: A short skirt for the Boston-Chan costume.
